args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a narrative genre, category, or story type characteristically or commonly includes the given motif, theme, character type, or other narrative element as part of its content.
args.justification: The existing canonical_rel_name 'typically_features' is slightly awkward and tied to the surface word 'features'. All these relations represent the same underlying predicate: a narrative category commonly includes a given kind of content. Normalizing to 'typically_includes' makes the predicate clearer, verb-object oriented, and reusable across narrative contexts without changing the semantics.
args.remark: Only the predicate label is being normalized from 'typically_features' to 'typically_includes'; semantics and class/group remain unchanged.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a narrative genre, category, or story type characteristically or commonly includes the given motif, theme, character type, or other narrative element as part of its content.
executed_decisions.justification: The existing canonical_rel_name 'typically_features' is slightly awkward and tied to the surface word 'features'. All these relations represent the same underlying predicate: a narrative category commonly includes a given kind of content. Normalizing to 'typically_includes' makes the predicate clearer, verb-object oriented, and reusable across narrative contexts without changing the semantics.
executed_decisions.remark: Only the predicate label is being normalized from 'typically_features' to 'typically_includes'; semantics and class/group remain unchanged.
